heading: execution stayed
subheading: a federal judge in philadelphia issued a stay of execution tuesday for mumia abu-jamal, the former black panther convicted of killing a police officer who was scheduled to die 2 december. abu-jamal, who has become a cause célèbre for death penalty opponents, received the stay after his attorneys filed a petition asking for a new trial. he was convicted of killing philadelphia police officer daniel faulkner in 1982, who was shot while trying to arrest abu-jamal's brother.
author: wired staff
text: a federal judge in philadelphia issued a stay of execution tuesday for mumia abu-jamal, the former black panther convicted of killing a police officer who was scheduled to die 2 december. abu-jamal, who has become a cause célèbre for death penalty opponents, received the stay after his attorneys filed a petition asking for a new trial. he was convicted of killing philadelphia police officer daniel faulkner in 1982, who was shot while trying to arrest abu-jamal's brother.
